meanings.definition: To give a new form or body to something.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, the artist decided to reembody the broken sculpture into a new masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to reembody her old dress into a trendy new outfit.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to reembody the torn newspaper back into a whole piece.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar reembodied itself into a beautiful butterfly, emerging from its cocoon.
meanings.sent5: The chef was able to reembody the leftovers into a delicious meal for the family.

meanings.sent1: The ghostly figure seemed to reembody itself in the old abandoned house.
meanings.sent2: The memories of her childhood reembodied in her mind as she visited her hometown.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers allowed him to reembody after being defeated by the villain.
meanings.sent4: The ancient spirit was said to reembody every century to protect the sacred land.
meanings.sent5: The old tradition was reembodied in the annual festival, bringing joy to the community.
